td.content: s:44 yr old F judge presents with badly damaged ankle (L) apparently having sustained large crushing blow: critical lightheadedness and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 61 in, Weight 158 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, severely injured ankle a:white f judge aged 44 yrs presents with traumatic blunt injury to L ankle p:administered dilaudid - 1 mg IV q 2-3h prn. May repeat if no relief in 30min, ancef - 1 gm IV q 8 hours, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and referred patient to orthopedics.

Value.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,
orthopedics

td.content: s:F aged 44 yrs presents for follow-up on amputated L ankle from 3 days ago. patient presents with severe swelling at the amputation site. she has history of severe stump pain. she denies drinking alcohol denies any smoking o:Height 61 in, Weight 157 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, No bone visible in the wound at this time, large wound a:Disarticulation of left ankle status p:performed Global postoperative visit - Completed, and prescribed oxycodone-acetaminophen 10-325 - 1 tab PO q 4 hours prn pain, ordered BMP, rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of left ankle, and referred patient to therapy, physical.

td.content: s:44 year old white f with 6 days old amputated left ankle presents for physical therapy visit. patient reports no issues o:, Extremity = no redness, no pus, good strength; Treatment provided: Successful bed mobility and theraputic exercises a:Disarticulation of left ankle status p:Start therapy sessions every three days until condition improves. performed Physical therapy evaluation - Completed; rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of left ankle - patient tolerated treatment well and appears to be compliant with home exercise program.
